## Indices

::: {.incremental}
- Measures a **multifaceted concept** that cannot be captured by a single feature. 
- Often can help:
	- Determine <span class="blB">policy priorities</span>
	- Benchmark or <span class="blB">monitor the performance</span> of current policies
:::

<!-- ----------------------------------------------------------------- -->
## Creating indices with models

::: {.incremental}
- Increasingly <span class="blB">popular</span> [@RN674; @RN671; @RN670; @RN687]
- **Shared component models (SCM)**
	- Linear combination of a shared factor (the INDEX) $+$ residual errors
	- <span class="blR">No</span> measurement errors
	- <span class="blR">Single</span> shared factor
:::

## Input data {.smaller}

::: {.incremental}
- Small area estimates of five features (cancer risk factor OR **unhealthy behaviors**) from <span class="blB">previous chapter</span>
	- Current smokers, risky alcohol consumption, overweight/obese, inadequate diet and inadequate physical
- Available as **point estimates** and **standard deviations** of proportions (inverse logit transformed)
- Details
	- Number of features **$K = 5$**
	- Number of small areas $N = 2221$
	- Number of shared factors $L = 2$
:::

## Generalised Shared Component Model (GSCM) {.scrollable .smaller}

$N$-dimensional multivariate normal distribution for the $k$th feature

$$
\begin{eqnarray}
    \mathbf{Y}_{k} & \sim & \jdistu{MVN}{N}{\boldsymbol{\mu}_{k}, \jdist{diag}{\boldsymbol{\sigma}_k}}
    \\
    \boldsymbol{\mu}_{k} & = & \mathbf{z} \lb{ \boldsymbol{\Lambda}_k }^T + \boldsymbol{\epsilon}_{k}
\end{eqnarray}
$$

Where:

:::{.incremental}
- $\mathbf{Y}_{k}$ is $N$-dimensional vector of estimates for the $k$th risk factor
- $\boldsymbol{\sigma}_k$ is $N$-dimensional vector of standard deviations for the $k$th risk factor
- $\boldsymbol{\mu}_{k}$ is $N$-dimensional vectors of true values for the $k$th risk factor
- $\mathbf{z}$ is a $N \times L$ matrix of shared factor scores, with independent columns
	- Leroux CAR priors [@RN366]
- $\boldsymbol{\epsilon}_{k}$ a $N$-dimensional vector of feature-specific residual errors for the $k$th feature with associated variance $\tau_k^2$
	- Leroux CAR priors
- $\boldsymbol{\Lambda}_k$ is the $k$th row of the $K$ by $L$ matrix of factor loadings
:::

Identifiability is enforced by:

:::{.incremental}
- Shared factors are homoscedastic (variances $=1$) [@RN674; @RN562]
- Hierarchical structural constraint [@RN679]
	- Factor loading matrix, $\boldsymbol{\Lambda}$, is constrained to be lower triangular with strictly positive diagonal entries [@RN674]
:::

Special cases:

:::{.incremental}
- Traditional shared component model
- Bayesian spatial factor models of [@RN674; @RN564]
- Generic Bayesian factor model
:::

## The four indices {.center}

- Factor 1: $z_{n1}$
- Factor 2: $z_{n2}$
- Health Behavior Index (HBI): $w_1 z_{n1} + w_2 z_{n2}$
- Population Adjusted Health Behaviors Index (PAHBI): $P_n \lb{ w_1 z_{n1} + w_2 z_{n2} }$

**Key findings** ðŸ“¢

::: {.incremental}
- <span class="blR">Incomplete or inefficient</span> policy decisions <div class="small-text">(if using a single shared factor or simplified spatial structure)</div>
	- <span class="blB">Motivates</span> use of GSCM
- The AIBIC reveals a <span class="blR">pronounced spatial autocorrelation</span> in unhealthy behaviors
	- Patterns reflect **remoteness** and **socioeconomic patterns** 
- Comparison empirical methods and the GSCM 
	- <span class="blR">Very different</span> policy decisions
